data.title: Awesome
data.text: I went here with low expectations, and I was blown away with how much fun I had!  It was really awesome.  I brought my 5 year old, and we had a BLAST.  I really recommend this for any family.

data.title: very nice
data.text: I thought it was interesting and they did a good job of displaying the items I would go back and spend an afternoon there again

data.title: Worth the drive from West Phoenix
data.text: I went with a 3rd grade class then 2 weeks later took my 18 year old son.  We had so much fun, I can not wait to go again.  It was exciting, educational and worth the time and reasonable admission price.  So much to do, so much to experience and so much to learn. Wonderful, wonderful museum

data.title: A GREAT FUN PLACE
data.text: This museum is wonderful. The dinosurs are spectular. There is so much to see. It is a lot of fun and a chance to get out of the heat. A great place to spend the afternoon with or without children. Have Fun

data.title: FUN FOR THE NIECE
data.text: It was a little pricey, but my niece LOVED the animatronic dinosaurs. They are a few skeletons and hands on areas as well. Of least interest to a 4 year old is the anthropological exhibits of the native Arizonans.

data.title: History and more.
data.text: You can find so many interesting items and history at this museum plus they sponsor walking tours throughout Mesa's Historic Districts.

data.title: the past
data.text: we like history.  so seeing the museum was a rare treat for us.  the movies were great.  show a way of life we well never see in person.  we like the book we could get about the part of mesa.  the peoplen were very help and knew a lot about the history.

data.title: History at its finest
data.text: This used to be an old high school that my grandma used to go to so it was very neat to see the building and learn about the history! They have different exhibits and it was just very fun! The kids loved it!

data.title: Great Day
data.text: This is a very well done museum. So much to see. Prehistoric, geological and SW Indians sections. We highly recommend it.

data.title: Closed to the public
data.text:
This is not to be confused with the wonderful Arizona Museum of Natural History on MacDonald St.  This is the old, abandoned school at the the N. Horne location.

My uncle and I arrived at the museum, labeled as Mesa Historical Museum, and there was an elevated sign saying it's open from 10 to 4.  But when we actually got to the building, it was a dilapidated school that was built in 1914 (it was not maintained well).  We walked in the door; there were no signs or maps of any kind, nor people to greet you.  In the building, we were the only ones there.  We found some placards on the wall that talked about Mesa's history.  We read a few of them, then a few minutes later, a woman came out of a doorway from an old classroom.  She asked, "Can I help you?"  I replied, "We don't know where to go."  Then she told us that this branch was closed, and then she shooed us out of the building right on the spot!  She was so rude.  We asked her when this branch of the museum is reopening -- she said it is closed permanently.  We felt especially unwelcome when she locked the door behind us on the way out!  What horrible customer service!  And there were no signs saying the building was closed to the public.  Never go to the N. Horne location -- it is apparently permanently closed.  First being confused where to go, then getting expelled from this private museum wasn't fun.  I'm only going to the downtown location on MacDonald St. from now on.

data.title: Filled with Dinosaurs, Native American Artifacts, Minerals, and Fun!!
data.text:
Had a day to check out the sites around Phoenix.  Went to the Mesa Historical Museum and was pleasantly surprised.  I love anything dinosaur and this museum didn't disappoint.  Great displays and full skeletons.  Many different species.

The Native American displays and artifacts depicted the local tribe - the Hohokum - who had many advances, including irrigation of crops.  Very informative. 

Many hands on activities for kids.  There were puzzles in various containers throughout the museum.  The puzzles were of dinosaurs, pottery, and other items of interest for kids.  Large pieces were appropriate for all kids.  There were also many different places to touch items like minerals, dinosaur bones, and the like.

data.title: Be sure & take the Kids,
data.text: This is a great place to go, My son's & I went & they are in their late 30's & Loved it, I enjoyed it so much & was surprised how close it was to our home, Mesa has so much to see & do & this is another excellent place to visit, be sure & take your kids. they will also love it. Fantastic.

data.title: Small but very interesting museum
data.text: I didn't even know Mesa had a historical museum until I was visiting their childrens museum and discovered their third Sunday free program. I took my daughters looking for something interesting to do and surprisongly had a really good time. They have a very broad spectrum of things to see and experience including dinosaur bones, gold mines and jails. The entrance and first exhibit hall look pretty mundane and boring with a few exhibits on fossils, etc. But as you make your way through they have a very interesting dinosuar exhibit with animated creatures and bones on display. Then as you make your way back they have an outdoor ares where you can pan for gold in a manmade stream. It's a little crowded but it's a lot of fun. If that's not enought they have a recreated jailhouse with cells that you can get into. A lot of fun for me and the kids that I never would have expected to find in Mesa.
